title: Quiz 4: Abortion Types & Management
description: Assess your ability to identify and manage different types of abortion.

questions.question: Which type of abortion is characterized by slight bleeding, abdominal discomfort, and a CLOSED cervix?
questions.explanation: Threatened abortion presents with slight bleeding and a closed os; the pregnancy may potentially continue.
questions.hint: The pregnancy is at risk but not definitely lost.

questions.question: Match the clinical feature to the type of abortion:

richContent.content: Identify the key diagnostic features for each.

pairs.right: Brownish discharge, symptoms of pregnancy subside, no expulsion

questions.explanation: Key distinctions involve the state of the cervix (os) and presence of infection or retention.
questions.hint: Focus on the state of the cervix and systemic symptoms.

questions.question: For a patient with a threatened abortion, bed rest is essential. To allay anxiety, sedatives like ___BLANK___ 30-60mg can be administered.
questions.explanation: Phenobarbitone is the specific sedative mentioned in the text for allaying anxiety in threatened abortion.
questions.hint: A common sedative starting with P.

questions.question: Which of the following are included in the management of Septic Abortion? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Management includes resuscitation, antibiotics, tetanus toxoid, and evacuation of infected products. Discharge is only after stabilization.
questions.hint: Treat it like a severe infection and shock.

questions.question: In threatened abortion, a vaginal examination should be performed immediately to assess the cervix.
questions.explanation: Vaginal examination is NOT usually carried out in threatened abortion due to fear of increasing uterine disturbance.
questions.hint: Think about the risk of disturbing the pregnancy further.

questions.question: What is the term for a mass of organized blood clot into which a dead fetus degenerates in a missed abortion?
questions.explanation: A carneous mole is the degenerated product of conception in a missed abortion.

questions.question: Prioritize the management for Incomplete Abortion with severe bleeding:
questions.explanation: Life-saving resuscitation first, then stop bleeding (drugs), then remove source (evacuation).

questions.question: What is the definition of 'Habitual Abortion'?

options.text: An abortion caused by habits like smoking

questions.explanation: Habitual abortion is defined as three or more consecutive spontaneous abortions.

questions.question: What defines a 'Therapeutic Abortion'?

options.text: Performed on medical grounds by registered practitioners

questions.explanation: Therapeutic abortion is performed legally on medical grounds to save the mother's life or prevent serious handicap.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of Post-Abortal Care (PAC)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: PAC involves treatment, family planning, and reproductive health care access. It is non-punitive.
questions.hint: Focus on care and prevention of future issues.
